 2.5 - INPUT MODALITIES
CONCURRENT INPUT MECHANISMS(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

Web content does not restrict use of input modalities available on a platform
except where the restriction is essential, required to ensure the security of
the content, or required to respect user settings.

These websites...

Make it easier for users to operate functionality through various inputs beyond
keyboard.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
A user opens a menu with a mouse, and then navigates between the menu items with
arrow keys. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/concurrent-input-mechanisms.html#examples]
